intro: Osmitopsis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid regions of North America. It typically features succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in harsh, dry environments. The flowers are usually showy, with bright colors and a bell-shaped structure, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Osmitopsis species are often found in rocky soils and can tolerate extreme temperature fluctuations. Botanically, they are classified within the family Polygonaceae, which includes other plants with similar structural and physiological traits.
